reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights to break train journey home from Switzerland. Interesting building in a quiet area within easy walking distance of the station, city centre and a large park. Large, comfortable room (No 6), excellent breakfast.
reviews.title: Characterful and comfortable

reviews.text: Stayed at the Molendal for 3 nights Bed & Breakfast, whilst visiting family in Holland.
reviews.title: Beautiful little Hotel
Hotel Molendal in Arnhem
reviews.text: The location is perfect as it is only a short walk into the town, but is right next to the lovely Sonsbeekpark. The view from my room was over a small canal/lake with a pair of swans who had a brood of 8 little cygnets. The area is quiet and select and although near the station, you can hardly hear the trains.
The hotel is a lovely old Dutch house, with lots of original period features & furniture. Exceptionally clean and comfortable, with pristine bedding and towels. Staff are efficient and friendly.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Arnhem; Parking is a problem

reviews.text: Very pleasant little breakfast room/ conservatory with a small outdoor terrace. The breakfast room doubles as a bar in the evenings. The food at breakfast was excellent - plentiful and fresh.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel when on business in Arnhem and thought it was lovely. The people working in it were extremely friendly and pleasant and the room I had was great - very bright (4 windows) and spacious. The ensuite bathroom was very small but it had a large shower (no bath) and was fine for my needs. The bed was extremely comfortable and everything was spotlessly clean. There was also a hairdryer and kettle/tea/coffee provided and a small tv which had a range of channels including BBC1, BBC2 and CNN news. Breakfast was the usual continental fare of different breads, cooked meats, cheese and also yoghurt, cereal, fruit etc. The hotel also has a code for wifi access (just ask). As regards location, it is on a lovely side street near the park and less than 10 minutes walk from the train station. I was on my own yet felt completely safe walking to/from the hotel in the evenings.
reviews.title: Lovely little hotel - very comfortable and with real character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Landed on their doorstep when the other hotels in town were full. The room rate was actually less than the Best Western. The hotel is charming and the rooms were very comfortable. The staff was friendly and made us feel welcomed. The breakfast was very good and satisfying without being rushed, in an enclosed garden room. There was also late night service available for hot tea and drinks. There is no elevator in the four story hotel. The room rates go down as the room location goes up. We stayed on the top floor. The room was large and the high ceiling in the bedroom followed the contours of the roof giving it a charming character. Although it is not in the center of town it is only a short walk to the main area where there is shopping, restaurants, banks and the train station.
reviews.title: Simply the best hotel in Arnhem

reviews.text: I only stayed here one night but was impressed by the hotel and the room was lovely - fully carpeted and generous proportions with a very high ceiling. It also had a balcony which in November is superfluous! Just be aware that when I stayed it was raining heavily and the old steel guttering was noisy and necessitated earplugs. Breakfast was very good in a nice room.
reviews.title: Lovely room in a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only potential negative is the lack of an elevator, but we actually like the stairs, with their huge stained / leaded glass windows and wall decorations. Our room is gigantic by european old-hotel standards, ~15 x 20 feet, with ceilings over 10 feet high, and a balcony overlooking the sonsbeek (the creek) and cattycorner to the sonsbeek park. We can watch a pair of swans urging their cygnets out of the water for entertainment. Breakfast is generous, good, and served until 10 AM (three sliced cheeses, several other spreadable cheeses, pate, cold cuts, warm boiled eggs, 8 or 9 sorts of breads and baked goods, cute, highly decorated cupcakes that taste like ladyfinger batter, good yoghurt with fruit, various honey and syrups and jams and nut spread, fresh coffee, tea, juice, milk). Really, really nice staff (all of them). Just a shower, not a bath, but a large one / well designed. No noise problems from any neighbors (above, below, or to the sides). Comfy bed (a real two person bed, none of those "two beds next to each other called one bed" that make cuddling so difficult in some Dutch hotels). It's maybe 10 minutes walk, with bags, from the train station, bus station, and the car-free, colorful, friendly downtown shopping area.
reviews.title: lovely old building, perfect balance of convenient location & quiet charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights in January. While the weather outside was bitterly cold and snowing, the Molendal was a cosy, warm home. The room was large and immaculately clean, the bar welcoming and open whenever required, and the breakfast hearty and tasty. Staff were friendly and helpful. Located just a brief stroll from the centre of town with its many bars and restaurants, this hotel is truly gezellig in the best Dutch tradition.
reviews.title: Charming and cosy

reviews.text: I stayed one night in a 'Comfort' room which was located on the top floor. Good bed and bathroom, and very friendly service. The room where they serve breakfast is gorgeous! (I'd rather have one of their other rooms which are more decorated (and located on the 1st and 2nd floor - but unfortunately they were all booked).
reviews.title: I stayed one night in a 'Comfort'...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 5 minutes walk from the train station, 5 minutes walk from the city center and 5 minutes walk from the park.
reviews.title: has to be better than this

reviews.text: Highly recommended if you're staying in Arnhem!
reviews.title: A perfect place - just like home

reviews.text: The only downside I can think of is that they do not have (yet?) an online reservation module, this means that you have to contact the hotel directly by phone or email to see if a room is available.
reviews.title: we loved it and we will be back!

reviews.text: Review based on deluxe room 6, rate 140 euro for 1 night.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel in Arnhem
Fantastic hotel in fantastic location
reviews.text: I had a lot of trouble finding reviews of this hotel on English language webites, but decided to give it a go after being charmed by their website.
